See also: dusche

German[edit]

Etymology[edit]

From French douche, from Italian doccia.

Pronunciation[edit]

  • IPA(key): /ˈduːʃə/ (standard)
  • IPA(key): /ˈdʊʃə/ (some speakers, perhaps dated)
  • Audio
    		(file)

Noun[edit]

Dusche f (genitive Dusche, plural Duschen)

  1. a shower
    • Eckhardt, Carolin, “7　Julia　日本のどこがお好きっ？ [7: Julia, What Place in Japan Do You Like?]”, in 奥さま Gutenグーテン Tagターク! [Housewife Good Day!] (fiction), Tokyo: Shueisha:
      Oh jeh! Sieht aus, als brauche ich erstmal eine Dusche…
      Oh dear! Looks like I need a shower first…
